intro: Pluchea adnata var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved blueweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, narrow leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual or short-lived perennial, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its small, blue or purple flowers are arranged in clusters, and the leaves are usually lance-shaped with a hairy texture. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
